definition: the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money, reinforce with fabric
details:
noun
- the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money
= example: the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money
= synonyms: occupation
- acting in conformity
= example: acting in conformity
- a conductor for transmitting electrical or optical signals or electric power
= synonyms: cable, transmission line
- something (as a cord or rope) that is long and thin and flexible
= example: something (as a cord or rope) that is long and thin and flexible
- the road consisting of railroad track and roadbed
= synonyms: railway line, rail line
- a commercial organization serving as a common carrier
- a particular kind of product or merchandise
= example: a particular kind of product or merchandise
= synonyms: line of business, product line, line of products, line of merchandise, business line
- a pipe used to transport liquids or gases
= example: a pipe used to transport liquids or gases
= synonyms: pipeline
- mechanical system in a factory whereby an article is conveyed through sites at which successive operations are performed on it
= synonyms: production line, assembly line
- a telephone connection
= synonyms: call
- a conceptual separation or distinction
= example: a conceptual separation or distinction
= synonyms: contrast, dividing line, demarcation
- a course of reasoning aimed at demonstrating a truth or falsehood
= synonyms: argumentation, logical argument, argument, line of reasoning
- (often plural) a means of communication or access
= synonyms: channel, communication channel
- a short personal letter
= example: a short personal letter
= synonyms: billet
- a mark that is long relative to its width
= example: a mark that is long relative to its width
- text consisting of a row of words written across a page or computer screen
= example: text consisting of a row of words written across a page or computer screen
- persuasive but insincere talk that is usually intended to deceive or impress
= example: persuasive but insincere talk that is usually intended to deceive or impress
- a succession of notes forming a distinctive sequence
= synonyms: air
- the descendants of one individual
= example: the descendants of one individual
= synonyms: descent
- a connected series of events or actions or developments
= synonyms: course
- a formation of people or things one behind another
= example: a formation of people or things one behind another
- a formation of people or things one beside another
= example: a formation of people or things one beside another
- a spatial location defined by a real or imaginary unidimensional extent
- in games or sports
- a fortified position, especially one marking the most forward position of troops
= example: a fortified position, especially one marking the most forward position of troops
- a single frequency (or very narrow band) of radiation in a spectrum
- the maximum credit that a customer is allowed
= synonyms: credit line, line of credit, bank line, personal credit line, personal line of credit
- space for one line of print (one column wide and 1/14 inch deep) used to measure advertising
= synonyms: agate line
- a length (straight or curved) without breadth or thickness
- a slight depression in the smoothness of a surface
= example: a slight depression in the smoothness of a surface
= synonyms: furrow, crease, seam, wrinkle, crinkle
verb
- reinforce with fabric
= example: reinforce with fabric
- fill plentifully
= example: fill plentifully
- cover the interior of
= example: cover the interior of
- mark with lines
= example: mark with lines
- make a mark or lines on a surface
= example: make a mark or lines on a surface
= synonyms: draw
- be in line with
= example: be in line with
= synonyms: run along
